bibl.title: Letter from Wilbur A. Sawyer to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1949

div1.p: Sawyer congratulates Hench on his success in arthritis research and informs him that Gorgas may be nominated for the Hall of Fame.

div1.head: Letter from Wilbur A. Sawyer to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1949
div1.opener:
770 Hilldale Avenue
Berkeley 8, California
September 5, 1949
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Many thanks for the reprints of your work on
Compound E in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis,- also
heartiest congratulations on the results of your research.
The newspapers here have carried items about the treatment, but
more especially concerning the related chemical problems. I can
imagine the difficulties you must be having with the army of science
writers and reporters.

Your remarks about Walter Reed remind me that a
movement is on foot to nominate General Gorgas for the Hall of
Fame. As a new member on the Committee I have suggested that it
would be well to know where the money for the bust is coming
from before the election instead of a couple of years afterward.

Please make note of my new address out here in
California, as shown in the letter-head above.

I think often of the courtesies and assistance you
gave me in Rochester. Please remember me to Mrs. Hench and
accept my best wishes.
